page.title: 10The Edney Gates
page.content: The{Edney Gates}are part of Tredegar House.They were made in 1714 by{ {William Edney.}They cost Â£650.After a while they started to rust.People searched for a blacksmith to restore them.They found a man called Paul Dennis.They cost Â£52 000 to be repaired.The gates were reopened on May 7th by the Mayor of Newport.We sat on the grass to watch the ceremony.We watched the Mayor and Mayoress get out of their carriage.A lady gave the Mayor some scissors and he cut the ribbon.The cover came slowly down.The gates were gold plated and were carved in very awkward places.They looked lovely.
